message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DC. 

The paper deals with information-theoretic limits of communication in wireless networks with limited local views, which is a topic closely related to information theory and network coding. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also focuses on multi-layer wireless networks, which falls under the scope of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The proposed transmission strategy involves interference avoidance, repetition coding, and network coding, which are techniques commonly used in system design and optimization, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also mentions throughput gain and achievable sum-rate, which are performance metrics commonly used in multimedia systems, suggesting cs.MM (Multimedia) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the design of distributed wireless networks, which is a topic related to distributed computing, making cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
